title: NAMC YS-11 autopilot tutorial: nav, heading & localizer explained! ‚úàÔ∏è
description:
In this complete NAMC YS-11 Autopilot Tutorial, we take the Famous Flyer 22 from Key West to Miami. Watch to get the NAV, Heading & Localizer modes explained so you can fly with confidence in MSFS!

We are leaving the beautiful Key West (KEYW) and heading to Miami Executive (KTMB) to demonstrate exactly how the automated systems handle a real flight plan. We cover:

- Navigation Mode: Following your GPS/Radio course.
- Heading Select: Steering the aircraft manually via the AP.
- Vertical Speed & Alt Hold: Managing your climb and cruise.
- Localizer Hold: Setting up for a precision approach.

By the end of this flight, you'll know exactly which buttons to press and when!

üìñ Chapters
00:00 - intro
00:24 - intro video
00:46 - where to find the autopilot controls
03:17 - using the heading mode
03:48 - using the vertical speed mode
06:03 - using the nav mode
13:07 - descending using the vertical speed mode
18:22 - using the loc mode
20:33 - recap
21:44 - outro video

üì∑Quick camera views

- shift 1: center cockpit view
- shift 2: throttle levelers
- shift 3: autopilot + trim
- shift 4: exterior lights
- shift 5: DC power
- shift 6: fuel control
- shift 7: CF power 
- shift 8: light dimmers + heater
- shift 9:cabin sign lightning and radio
- shift 0: copilot light dimmers + heater
